items.title: Pizza Hut's parent company Yum Brands says it's considering selling chain
items.summary: Pizza Hut has nearly 20,000 stores in more than 100 countries, and its international sales were up 2% in the first nine months of this year. China is its second-largest market outside the U.S.

items.title: Moody's ups Airtel ratingto Baa2, outlook to 'stable'
items.summary: Moody's has raised the credit rating for Bharti Airtel, a notable recognition of the company's robust financial improvements. As its market presence expands, competition is becoming less intense, while a favorable regulatory climate paves the way for growth. This upgrade underscores Bharti Airtel's commendable market stance and sound financial health, setting the stage for future achievements.

items.title: Tata Power to invest Rs 11,000 crore in Pune pumped hydro project
items.summary: Tata Power is setting the wheels in motion for a significant pumped hydro storage venture in Shirawta, Pune, with a staggering investment of 11,000 crore rupees. Construction kicks off in July, anticipated to span five years. The financial blueprint follows a 70-30 debt-to-equity structure.

items.title: American Airlines to cut hundreds of jobs at Fort Worth Headquarters in Texas following Q3 loss
items.summary: American Airlines is laying off hundreds of corporate employees, mainly at its Fort Worth headquarters, after posting a third-quarter loss of 17 cents per share.

items.title: LG plans Make-in-India push for its electronics machinery
items.summary: In a strategic pivot, LG Electronics is evaluating the potential relocation of a portion of its factory equipment production to India, reflecting a positive outlook on the country's burgeoning electronics sector. Meanwhile, LG Corp has announced the upcoming establishment of a global research and development hub in Noida, projected to generate around 500 new employment opportunities.

items.title: Radisson aims to more than double hotel count in India by 2030: Exec
items.summary: Global hotel chain also plans forays into branded residences and stadium hotels

items.title: After SC relief to Vodafone Idea, Airtel to ring govt for AGR dues relief
items.summary: In a bold move, Bharti Airtel has announced plans to appeal for a reassessment of its Adjusted Gross Revenue obligations to the government. This request comes on the heels of the Supreme Court's recent ruling favoring Vodafone Idea, opening the door for similar reviews.

items.title: Expats in Indian firms must become EPFO members: HC
items.summary: Expatriates working in India must now join the Employees' Provident Fund Organisation. The Delhi High Court upheld this rule for international workers of Indian firms. They can withdraw the full amount only upon retirement at 58 or due to total incapacity. This ruling impacts expatriates with shorter work durations in India.

items.title: Allow no exceptions in flight duty and rest norms, pilots' body urges regulator
items.summary: Pilots' group ALPA India is pushing the DGCA to fully implement new flight duty rules. They say selective relaxations benefit airlines over pilot safety. The new norms offer more rest time. Some clauses are already in effect, with others planned for November 1. Pilots are directly impacted by fatigue concerns.

items.title: NaBFID to be repositioned as a global financial institution
items.summary: "The company was formed in a hurry with the idea of starting operations quickly, while branding the institution was not an immediate priority," said one of the persons cited above. "However, over the last few months, the government is keen to rename it to reflect the work undertaken by them," the person added. NaBFID was established under the National Bank for Financing Infrastructure and Development Act, 2021, and is 100% owned by the government.

items.title: Zee strengthens lead in movie broadcasting with 28.7% share in Q2FY26
items.summary: Zee Entertainment Enterprises has reached a three-year peak in Hindi movie broadcasting. The company secured a 28.7% share in the Hindi movie cluster for Q2FY26. Zee Cinema reclaimed its position as the number one Hindi movie channel. This success is attributed to blockbuster movie premieres and a robust content strategy. Zee also leads in regional movie segments.

items.title: IBM layoffs: Tech giant to cut thousands of roles amid focus on software growth — Who will get affected?
items.summary: IBM layoffs: International Business Machines Corp is set to cut jobs in the fourth quarter to focus on software and service. Some US workers may be affected by the job reduction.

items.title: Domestic demand drags fuel exports down 21%
items.summary: India's fuel exports saw a significant drop in October. Refiners focused on meeting strong domestic demand during the festive season. Refinery operational issues also contributed to the decline. Nayara Energy's exports remained impacted by sanctions. Despite this, domestic petrol sales saw a year-on-year increase. Diesel sales experienced a slight dip.

items.title: India strategic launchpad for next wave of obesity care
items.summary: India is poised to establish itself as a pivotal hub for semaglutide API manufacturing. Leading pharmaceutical firms are amplifying their production capabilities to seize a significant stake in the expanding international market for obesity and diabetes treatments. With the expiration of semaglutide's exclusivity, India finds itself in a prime position to spearhead advancements in underserved markets.

items.title: Urban demand's in growth territory, qcomm a big driver, says Sunil D'Souza, MD TCPL
items.summary: Urban demand in India is now catching up to rural demand. Quick commerce is a major driver of this shift, alongside e-commerce, modern trade, and general trade. Tata Consumer Products sees this trend boosting its sales. Easing inflation and government tax cuts are also contributing to increased consumer spending in cities. The company is adapting to these changing market dynamics.

items.title: Knee implant ceiling rates to be reviewed
items.summary: Next week, the National Pharmaceutical Pricing Authority (NPPA) of India will delve into the pricing caps for knee implants, a move that previously helped slash costs for patients.

items.title: Hyundai launches upgraded Venue and Venue NLine
items.summary: Tarun Garg, Whole-Time Director & COO, Hyundai Motor India Limited, said the new Venue would be exclusively manufactured in India for global markets

items.title: Small SUVs enter the fast track on tax boost, hatchbacks struggle to catch up
items.summary: Tax cuts are boosting small SUV sales, increasing their market share significantly. Hatchbacks are seeing a decline in their contribution to overall passenger vehicle sales. However, Maruti Suzuki reports a surge in demand for small cars from new customers upgrading from two-wheelers. The company is working to meet this growing demand.

items.title: BOC aviation and Akasa Air sign deal for 3 aircraft
SpiceJet appoints Sanjay Kumar as Executive Director
items.summary: Mr. Kumar will lead the airline’s strategic initiatives focused on expansion, operational excellence, and business transformation

items.title: IMFA to buy Tata Steel’s Kalinganagar ferrochrome plant in Rs 610 crore deal
items.summary: Indian Metals & Ferro Alloys (IMFA) is acquiring Tata Steel's ferrochrome plant in Odisha for ₹610 crore, a move expected to make it India's largest and the world's sixth-largest ferro alloy producer. This acquisition will accelerate IMFA's expansion plans, boosting its production capacity significantly and leading to cost savings and operational synergies.

items.title: Coal stocks at power plants seen ending FY26 at 62 mt, higher than year-start levels amid steady supply
items.summary: The government anticipates ending the year with 62 million tonnes of coal stocks at power plants, a significant increase from the start of the financial year. This higher stock is attributed to improved fuel supply and lower power demand, influenced by favorable weather conditions and increased availability of renewable energy sources.

items.title: Amul's parent ranks top at ICA World Cooperative Monitor 2025 — Details here
items.summary: Amul's parent company, Gujarat Cooperative Milk Marketing Federation Ltd, ranked as the top co-operative in the world in the ICA World Cooperative Monitor 2025 rankings.&nbsp;

items.title: No blanket scrapping of renewable project bids, says ministry
items.summary: Renewable energy authorities are set to conduct a thorough review of projects that have been granted letters but are missing power sale agreements. The cancellations will be tactfully limited to projects with slim prospects for deal-making, thereby safeguarding other bids from outright dismissal.

items.title: Specialty steel gets fresh PLI round with ₹2,100 cr outlay
items.summary: India's government has launched a new incentive scheme for specialty steel. This third round offers ₹2,100 crore to boost production of high-grade steel. The scheme is more flexible for investors and encourages more companies to participate. Benefits will be available for five years starting FY26. This initiative aims to make India a global leader in specialty steel manufacturing.

items.title: Lower global prices plague local steel companies: Steel secretary Sandeep Poundrik
items.summary: The landscape for Indian steel manufacturers is rocky, marked by shifting raw material costs and delayed expansion of mining operations. The international steel market is saturated, resulting in a plunge in prices that have hit a five-year low, which particularly squeezes smaller entities within the sector. To address upcoming projected capacity needs, a considerable infusion of capital is essential.

items.title: SEBI: Financial intermediaries key to strengthening market integrity, says Chairman Tuhin Kanta Pandey
items.summary: Institutions to step up their governance and transparency standards, and suggested that greater collaboration between regulators and market participants would help to protect investors and maintain market integrity," SEBI Chief.

items.title: Flight operations hit at Delhi’s IGI Airport; IndiGo issues advisory to passengers
items.summary: Delhi’s Indira Gandhi International Airport is among the busiest in India, where dense flight schedules often strain air traffic capacity, especially during peak hours.

items.title: Finance ministry rejects hike in food subsidy bill, pushes for open market grain sales
items.summary: The finance ministry has rejected a proposal to increase the food subsidy outlay, citing a need for prudent spending. Instead, the Department of Expenditure suggested liquidating surplus grains in the open market and cleaning up beneficiary databases to reduce costs and curb leakages.

items.title: India’s top 1% grew wealth share by 62% between 2000 and 2023, says G20 inequality report
items.summary: India's wealthiest 1% saw their wealth share surge by 62% from 2000 to 2023. This trend mirrors global patterns where wealth concentration is increasing. A new report highlights extreme inequality as a choice, not an inevitability. It calls for global coordination and proposes an International Panel on Inequality to guide policy.

items.title: Have faith in India's economy, do not give in to foreign bullying: FM Sitharaman
items.summary: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman encouraged Indians to embrace economic optimism. She highlighted the nation's significant progress over the last decade, moving from the tenth largest economy to the fifth. Sitharaman urged a focus on India-centric research to benefit the Global South. She emphasized the importance of data-driven studies and technological advancements in driving economic growth and policy-making.

items.title: Mistry tells Tata Trusts he doesn't want to challenge ouster
items.summary: In his letter, Mistry invoked the spirit of Ratan Tata ‘who always placed the public interest before his own’, and hoped that the trustees' future actions will be guided by transparency, good governance and public interest.

items.title: M&M Q2 net profit rises 16% to ₹3,673 crore, revenue up 22%
Steep forex loss prompts IndiGo to eye more foreign flights
items.summary: Excluding the impact of forex changes, IndiGo made a profit of  ₹104 crore during the September quarter against a  ₹2,347 crore profit in the June quarter, and  ₹754 crore a year ago.

items.title: Adani Enterprises Q2  PAT surges 84% to ₹3,199 crore; Board approves ₹25,000 crore Rights Issue
MFI loanbook continues to shrink, asset quality improves in Q2
items.summary: The microfinance loan portfolio saw a decline in the September quarter. However, lenders reported better asset quality.  Disbursements increased, with a rise in larger loan amounts.  Borrower exposure to multiple lenders also grew, indicating adherence to new regulations.  This shows a resilient sector balancing growth and sustainability.

items.title: CAFE-3 norms stir divisions among carmakers; SIAM readies unified response
items.summary: The draft norms, set to take effect from April 2027, have triggered internal divisions between EV-focused firms such as Tata Motors and Mahindra & Mahindra, and hybrid-leaning automakers like Maruti Suzuki, Toyota, and Honda.

items.title: We are confident of meeting regulatory norm for Expenses of Management for this fiscal: Niva Bupa Health Insurance CFO
items.summary: Over the last three years, we have consistently seen a 150–200 bps improvement annually. The trajectory remains strong and sustainable.

items.title: SBICAP Securities appoints Bhuvaneshwari A. as Managing Director & CEO
items.summary: SBICAP Securities has appointed Bhuvaneshwari A. as its new Managing Director and Chief Executive Officer. She brings over three decades of experience from SBI. Bhuvaneshwari aims to make SBICAP Securities a digitally driven, customer-centric, and innovation-led investment services company. The focus will be on strengthening technology, expanding products, and deepening customer engagement.

items.title: Banks seek higher exposure limit for M&A financing
items.summary: Also want to fund buy of unlisted companies; funding of acquisitions in tranches

items.title: SBI Q2 profit up 10% to ₹20,160 crore, boosted by YES Bank stake sale
items.summary: Bank’s balance sheet size crosses ₹100 lakh crore mark; ups guidance on credit growth

items.title: Paytm Q2 Results: Profit falls 98% to Rs 21 crore, revenue rises 24%
items.summary: Paytm Q2 Results: Fintech firm Paytm reported a significant 98% drop in net profit to Rs 21 crore for Q2, despite a 24% rise in revenue to Rs 2061 crore. The company attributes revenue growth to increased subscription merchants and financial services distribution. Paytm plans to expand merchant offerings, grow financial services, and leverage AI for product innovation and market expansion.

items.title: Paytm Q2 Results: Fintech major's net profit at  ₹21 crore; revenue jumps 24% — Details here
items.summary: Paytm Q2 Results: Fintech major's net profit stood at  ₹21 crore as of the July to September quarter of the financial year 2025-26, while the revenue from core operations jumped 24%. Here's how the company performed in Q2 FY2025-26.&nbsp;

items.title: Mehli Mistry resigns from Tata Trusts, citing Ratan Tata’s legacy and values
items.summary: Mehli Mistry, a long-time associate of Ratan Tata, has stepped down as trustee of Tata Trusts citing his commitment to Tata’s values of transparency and public interest. His exit follows a disagreement over his reappointment to key trusts.

items.title: State Bank of India embarks on drive to ease KYC process
items.summary: In a transformative step forward, the State Bank of India is unveiling a robust initiative designed to overhaul its Know Your Customer process. Soon, customers will streamline their experience by providing KYC information just once at any SBI branch. This visionary project is set to be realized by March 2026.

items.title: Mehli Mistry exits Tata Trusts, cites Ratan Tata's quote in heartfelt letter to all trustees: ‘Nobody is bigger than…’
items.summary: On October 27, this year, Mistry's role as trustee with the Tata Trusts came to an end. As per the resolution of the Board of Trustees of the Tata Trusts taken on October 17, last year, Mistry was to be reappointed as a lifetime Trustee.

items.title: India’s Amul ranked world’s leading cooperative by International Cooperative Alliance
items.summary: The ICA recognition highlights Amul’s strong growth, innovation, and farmer-led governance model

items.title: SBI open to collaborate with foreign banks on acquisition finance: Chairman CS Setty
items.summary: SBI Chairman CS Setty stated the bank is ready to partner with foreign banks for acquisition finance. This follows the Reserve Bank of India's announcement to permit local banks to fund domestic acquisitions. SBI will leverage its in-house expertise and existing corporate finance vertical for these deals. The bank also plans a revamped Yono app launch by December.

items.title: Privatisation of banks unlikely to hurt financial inclusion drive, national interest: FM Nirmala Sitharaman
items.summary: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman addressed concerns about bank privatisation. She stated that nationalisation in 1969 did not fully achieve its financial inclusion goals. Government control led to unprofessionalism in public sector banks. Sitharaman expressed confidence that professionalised banks will better serve national and banking interests. The government is proceeding with IDBI Bank's privatisation and has consolidated other public sector banks.

items.title: Nuvama announces 1:5 stock split, Rs 70 per share interim dividend
items.summary: Nuvama Wealth Management has announced a 1:5 stock split and a Rs 70 interim dividend. The company reported its Q2 earnings, showing a marginal decrease in consolidated net profit. Revenue from operations saw an increase compared to the previous year. The stock split will divide each Rs 10 share into five Rs 2 shares.

items.title: IndiGo expects 'slight uptick' in costs due to new FDTL norms: CFO
items.summary: IndiGo anticipates a slight increase in operational costs due to the second phase of revised flight duty time limitation norms for pilots, effective November 1. The airline also faces cost implications from Aircraft on Ground (AOG) and damp leasing, though it expects higher yields to offset these expenses.

items.title: Q2 Adani Ports profits scale new highs, while Adani Enterprises falters on weak commodities business
items.summary: Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone reported robust profit growth, while the group flagship, Adani Enterprises, saw a decline in core revenue and profit; however, significant exceptional gains helped.

items.title: IMFA to acquire Tata Steel’s Kalinganagar ferro chrome plant for ₹610 crore
items.summary: Subject to regulatory approvals, the company expects to close the transaction in three months.

items.title: Will meet fiscal deficit target of FY26: Finance Minister Sitharaman
items.summary: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman is confident the government will meet its fiscal deficit target of 4.4 per cent of GDP by March 2026.  This commitment was made in Parliament.  The focus will now shift to the debt-to-GDP ratio.  The minister urged citizens to believe in India's economy and its people's achievements.

items.title: NPCI warns public against rising ‘digital arrest’ scams: What to do if you get a fake call
items.summary: The National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) has cautioned citizens against a growing wave of ‘digital arrest’ scams in which fraudsters impersonate police or government officials to extort money. The organisation advised the public to document suspicious calls, verify identities, and report incidents to the national cybercrime helpline at 1930.

items.title: Tax cuts, rate cuts, and a consumption boom: SBI dials up credit growth outlook
items.summary: After a historic GST reform, a series of rate cuts, and multiple measures to smooth credit flow, SBI bets credit growth this year will be better than what it predicted as recently as August.

items.summary: Highlighting India’s “growth with inclusion” model, he noted that over 170 million jobs were created between 2016–17 and 2023–24, women’s workforce participation doubled, and unemployment fell to 3.2%

items.title: Mehli Mistry hints at truce
Bihar Elections 2025: Here's how to check your name in voter list — step-by-step guide
items.summary: The first phase of Bihar Elections 2025 begins on November 6. Before voting, citizens must verify their voter ID and check their name in the updated Special Integrated Revision (SIR) Final Voter List.

items.title: The big takeaway from IndiGo's Q2 results: India's biggest airline is preparing for a rainy day
items.summary: IndiGo continues to have over 40 planes grounded, all powered by Pratt &amp; Whitney. The airline currently does not have visibility on when this will end, although the percentage of Pratt &amp; Whitney-powered planes in IndiGo’s fleet is decreasing.

items.title: Palantir's bull run stalls as Burry bets against the AI darling; shares fall 6%
items.summary: Palantir Technologies shares dropped 6 percent on Tuesday. This occurred even after the company released a strong quarterly update and forecast. Demand for its data analytics services is rising due to AI adoption. Investor Michael Burry has placed bearish bets on Palantir. This has raised concerns about the AI and tech industry's spending.

items.title: Probability of default explained: How to assess credit risk and make smarter bond investment decisions
items.summary: The probability of default in bonds measures credit risk and helps investors evaluate borrower reliability, compare yields, and make data-driven fixed-income investment decisions with balanced portfolio risk.

items.title: HyFarm adopts  ‘seed-to-shelf’ approach to growing quality potatoes for French fries
items.summary: The company’s efforts begin with seed multiplication and end on the consumer’s plate

items.title: Atal Bridge becomes Ahmedabad’s top tourist hotspot, generates Rs 27.7 crore in revenue
items.summary: The Atal Foot Over Bridge on the Sabarmati River has become Ahmedabad’s most-visited tourist attraction, drawing more than 77 lakh visitors and earning Rs 27.7 crore in revenue since its inauguration in August 2022. Built at a cost of Rs 74 crore, the bridge has recovered over a third of its construction cost in just three years.

items.summary: OpenAI introduces IndQA, a new benchmark for evaluating AI systems on Indian culture and languages

items.summary: Bitcoin prices dropped below $104,000 on Tuesday, 4 November 2025, as pressures in the macroeconomic environment and investors booking profits loomed over crypto market gains. Here's what the expert says.

items.title: Pakistan’s inflation climbs to 6.2% in October as core prices surge: What’s driving the rise
items.summary: Pakistan’s inflation rate increased for the second consecutive month in October, reaching 6.2 per cent year-on-year, as prices climbed sharply across non-food and food categories.

items.title: DGCA plans overhaul of air ticket refund, cancellation rules
items.summary: Draft norms cap cancellation fees, mandate faster refunds, and introduce 48-hour “look-in” period

items.title: Hinduja Group Chairman Gopichand Hinduja dies at 85 in London
items.summary: Fondly known as ‘GP’, Gopichand P Hinduja was celebrated for his visionary leadership that turned a modest family trading venture into a global powerhouse.

items.title: IndiGo warns of flight delays in Delhi due to air traffic congestion
items.summary: IndiGo has issued a travel advisory warning passengers of potential flight delays originating from Delhi due to air traffic congestion. The airline acknowledged that this could lead to extended wait times and advised passengers to check their flight status before traveling. Their teams are working to assist passengers and minimize inconvenience.

items.title: Bajaj Financial Securities buys stake in Lemnisk as early investors partly exit
items.summary: Bajaj Financial Securities has acquired a stake in customer data platform Lemnisk through a secondary transaction, offering partial exits to early investors like growX Ventures. The deal highlights the growing demand for real-time customer data platforms and AI-driven personalization among Indian enterprises. Investors maintain their stakes, underscoring continued confidence in Lemnisk's long-term potential.

items.title: India, Israel sign MoU to enhance cooperation in advanced technology and joint production: All you need to know
items.summary: India and Israel on November 4 signed a major defence cooperation agreement in Tel Aviv to strengthen collaboration in advanced technology, joint production, and counter-terrorism. The new MoU sets a long-term roadmap for innovation-led defence partnership between the two nations.

items.summary: The round also saw participation from Coinbase Ventures, Alliance DAO, and others.

items.title: Wheels India adopts five pronged growth strategy to drive revenue
items.summary: Wheels India is charting a five-pronged growth strategy, aiming for ₹500 crore in additional international business within construction equipment and tractors. The auto-component maker is also focusing on cast aluminium wheels, wind mills, hydraulic cylinders, and air suspension to boost both domestic and export revenues, expecting to outpace market growth.

items.title: Brokers’ body urges Sebi to bring back Bank Nifty weekly options
items.summary: ANMI says speculation concerns will ease with upcoming index reconstitution and stronger safeguards; regulator yet to respond to plea as losses from weekly trades remain under scrutiny.

items.title: Gold and Silver Prices This Evening: Precious metals witness a steep decline — check out key details
items.summary: Gold and silver prices extended their decline today, with gold slipping by ₹1,608 and silver by ₹2,500 on the MCX. The fall mirrors global trends as investors book profits amid a stronger dollar and cautious sentiment ahead of the Federal Reserve’s December policy meeting.

items.title: Berger Paints Q2 profit drops 23% to Rs 206 crore on weak monsoon demand
items.summary: Berger Paints India reported a 23% drop in September quarter profit. Extended monsoon rains affected demand. Revenue saw a slight increase. The company expects demand to pick up after Diwali. Improved weather and pent-up demand are anticipated. Raw material prices are also expected to aid gross margins.

items.title: Angel One settles SEBI case with ₹34.57 lakh payment over disclosure lapses

items.title: India to become world’s third-largest economy soon, says Finance Minister Sitharaman
items.summary: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Tuesday said India has grown from the world’s tenth-largest economy in 2014 to the fifth-largest today and is set to become the third-largest in the coming years, driven by sustained reforms and inclusive growth.

items.summary: At 11:36 a.m. ET, the Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 0.34%, the S&amp;P 500 shed 0.70%, and the Nasdaq Composite lost 1.20%

items.title: Novelis Q2 net income rises 27% YoY to $163 million on higher aluminium prices
items.summary: Novelis Inc., a Hindalco subsidiary, reported a 27% year-on-year net income growth to $163 million for the September quarter, despite a fire at its Oswego plant. Net sales rose 10% to $4.7 billion, driven by higher aluminum prices, though adjusted EBITDA declined 9% due to tariff impacts and scrap prices.

items.title: SBI plans to roll out single-window KYC for all products by March
items.summary: SBI’s move comes amid growing calls to simplify the KYC process, which, though essential to prevent fraud and update customer data, has long been seen as a compliance burden.

items.title: Chhattisgarh Train Collision Update: At least 4 feared dead near Bilaspur; Railways announces Rs 10 lakh for deceased, Rs 5 lakh for injured
items.summary: At least four people were killed and several others injured when a passenger train collided with a stationary goods train near Jairamnagar station in Bilaspur district of Chhattisgarh on Tuesday afternoon. Rescue operations are underway, and the Railways has issued multiple helpline numbers for passengers and their families.

items.title: ISMA urges Centre to allow 2 million tonnes sugar exports as production seen rising 16% on bumper Maharashtra, Karnataka output

This request follows projections of a 16% year-on-year increase in gross sugar production, driven by favorable weather and increased sugarcane cultivation in Maharashtra and Karnataka.

items.title: SBICAP Securities names Bhuvaneshwari A. as MD & CEO from November 1
items.summary: A seasoned banker with over 30 years of experience, she joined SBI in 1994 as a Probationary Officer and most recently served as Chief General Manager of the bank’s Thiruvananthapuram Circle.

items.title: Arvind Fashions reports 25% growth in footwear as GST reduction boosts consumer demand
items.summary: Arvind Fashions' CEO Amisha Jain reported a settlement in BIS certification disruptions, leading to over 25% year-on-year growth in the footwear category during the July-September quarter. Reduced GST rates are expected to boost demand in the coming months, with premium apparel brands like US Polo, Tommy Hilfiger, and Calvin Klein maintaining strong growth momentum.

items.title: FSSAI asks States to ensure disposal of seized, expired food items complies with regulations

items.title: Four deaths in Bilaspur train collision
items.summary: A collision between a local train and a stationary goods train near Bilaspur, Chhattisgarh, resulted in four passenger fatalities and multiple injuries. Preliminary findings indicate the passenger train may have disregarded a red signal. Indian Railways has announced ex-gratia payments for the deceased and injured, with a detailed inquiry by the Commissioner of Railway Safety to follow.

items.summary: Former President Barack Obama criticised a viral AI-generated video shared by President Donald Trump, calling it a tactic to divert voters from real issues. The remarks came as mass protests under the “No Kings” banner gathered momentum across the United States.
